titlestmt.titleproper: Society of Southwest Archivists records, Inclusive: 1970-2017, Bulk: 1973-1993, 2003-2016

note.p: © 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: The Society of Southwest Archivists records consist of manuscripts that chronicle the regional archival organization's history since the early 1970's. These records include correspondence, financial documents, legal documents, literary productions, and photographic materials that all recount the society's annual meetings, committee activities, and works pertaining to the general membership.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The Society of Southwest Archivists, founded in 1972, is the professional regional organization for archivists in Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, Oklahoma, Arkansas, and Louisiana. Organized to promote best archival practices, to educate members, and to foster interdisciplinary ties to historic preservation groups, the society has provided these services and more to hundreds of members throughout its history.

A group of interested people met to form the society in May 1972. These original founders drafted a constitution and elected officers. The first annual meeting, which fulfilled many of the initial goals of the organization, was held in 1973 in Norman, Oklahoma. After the second meeting in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, meetings were held in Texas for the next eleven years, but moved around the region more after 1986. Governed by a president and other officers comprising the Executive Board, the society gradually added various committees over time to select annual meeting sites, to design programs for the annual meeting, to produce a newsletter (The Southwestern Archivist), and to complete various other organizational functions. The society has also developed several awards that have been given to members and non-members through the years.
The Society of Southwest Archivists continues today to provide educational opportunities and promote best practices among its more than five hundred members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Society of Southwest Archivists records include materials from the years prior to its organization in 1972 to 2017.

Series I. Annual Meetings contain correspondence, programs, photographs, registration materials, minutes, and other documents produced for or about the society’s annual meetings. The site moves each year, currently alternating between a Texas city and a non-Texas city.

Series II. Committee Documents, the largest series in the collection, consists of minutes, correspondence, notes, reports, and other materials pertaining to the society’s officers and committees. These committees highlight the various functions of the organization.

Series III. General Membership, as its name suggests, houses materials pertaining to the society’s membership. Prominent materials include membership directories, copies of the society’s newsletter The Southwestern Archivist, essays detailing brief historical accounts of the society, as well as other materials.

This collection contains flash drives, audio cassettes, compact discs, and floppy disks that were not able to be read at the time this finding aid was created. Once a machine is located that can read these materials, all documents should be printed and placed within the collection.

Researchers looking for information on specific annual meetings should consult the appropriate folders in the annual meeting series as well as those in the local arrangements committee subseries of the committee series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to this finding aid, the collection had been partially arranged and inventoried according to creator and occasionally by year. Extensive reorganization to make the collection more accessible to the researcher was necessary, including filing manuscripts by committee rather than person. The original order for much of the annual meeting series was maintained.

Currently, the Society of Southwest Archivists records are arranged in three series: I. Annual Meeting Materials, II. Committee Documents, and III. General Membership. Series I. is further divided into subseries based on the specific annual meeting, while Series II. is arranged according to committee or office.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Society of Southwest Archivists records, Accession #1391, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher and Thomas DeShong. Released on 2018-06-28.

relatedmaterial.head: Related references
relatedmaterial.bibref: Schultz, Charles R. “Society of Southwest Archivists: The First Two Decades.” Lubbock, Texas, 1992.
“Two Decades of Fun, Frivolity, and Professionalism: The SSA Experience.” Norman, Oklahoma, 1992.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains correspondence, programs, minutes, registration forms, notes, and other materials pertaining to the annual meetings held by the Society of Southwest Archivists. The amount of material varies by year and relative proximity to Texas and The Texas Collection, so there are some notable gaps in the series. The materials, overall, are in good condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains materials organized by committee, including correspondence, various financial and literary documents, and a few photographs. Some manuscripts in this series are closely related to specific annual meetings, such as the Site Selection Committee and the Local Arrangements Committee. The Executive Board correspondence filed as “Leon Miller” was kept together because it was numbered consecutively, even though Miller had served on many committees. Overall, the series is in excellent condition.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series III. General Membership contains correspondence from archivists inquiring about their membership status in SSA, various letters written about relevant political bills, essays concerning the history of the society, membership directories, newsletters, and other printed materials. There are also a number of three-dimensional artifacts that were produced for various committees and annual meetings. Overall, the series is in good condition.
